results.title: Trump Had More Than 300 Classified Documents at Mar-a-Lago
results.abstract: The National Archives found more than 150 sensitive documents when it got a first batch of material from the former president in January, helping to explain the Justice Department’s urgent response.

results.title: What Are the Real Warning Signs of a Mass Shooting?
results.abstract: While some mass shootings are committed by people with diagnosed mental illnesses, a life crisis is a better predictor of violence, researchers say.

media.caption: Many experts who study how to prevent mass shootings have come to focus on marked changes in behavior, demeanor or appearance, uncharacteristic fights or arguments, or telling others of plans for violence.

results.title: Do You Believe Scientists, or Your Dog’s Crying Eyes?
results.abstract: Researchers disagree about whether your best friend tears up more when it is reunited with you, but agree that the wet eyes of a pup make you want to care for it.

media.caption: When dogs exhibit “watery, shiny eyes,” it “facilitates human caregiving,” said Takefumi Kikusui, an animal behavior expert at Azabu University in Japan.

results.title: What Russians See in the News: A War Over Western Plans to Subjugate Them
results.abstract: In the Kremlin-controlled news media, the war is not about Ukraine, but about a long history of enemies trying to keep Russia down.

results.byline: By Matt Richtel and Annie Flanagan
results.title: A Teen’s Journey Into the Internet’s Darkness and Back Again
results.abstract: As anxiety and depression soar among adolescents, researchers struggle to understand how exactly social media affects mental health.

media.caption: “I feel like if I was born in 2000 B.C. in the Alps, I’d still be depressive, but I think it’s wildly exacerbated by the climate we live in,” said C, who is 22 and lives in Salt Lake City.
